data.title: DFI Retail Group's Underlying Core Profit on Track to Top Guidance â€” Market Talk
data.description: DFI Retail Group's underlying core profit is on track to top the upper-end of the company's full-year guidance, says DBS Group Research's Zheng Feng Chee in a note. The Singapore-listed retailer's 3Q underlying core net profit grew 48% on year. The company's top-end US$270 million forecast for 2025 implies 35% on year growth, he notes. He doesn't see major operational headwinds in 4Q, expecting profit growth momentum to be sustained. DFI's convenience-store segment could be a key earnings driver with a potential operating margin target of 6%, given improved mix towards the higher-margin ready-to-eat sub-segment, he adds. DBS maintains its buy rating and US$3.90 target price. Shares gain 2.65% to US$3.48. (megan.cheah@wsj.com)

data.title: Hoya 2Q Net Profit Narrowly Missed Y55.60B Expected in Quick Poll of Analysts
Turkey - Factors to watch on Oct 31
data.description:
Here are news, reports and events that may affect Turkish financial markets on Friday.

The lira was quoted at 41.9930 against the U.S. dollar at Thursday's close.

The main BIST 100 share index closed 0.31% lower on Thursday at 10,837.30points.

GLOBAL MARKETS

Asian shares are set for a seventh straight month of gains on Friday, after upbeat earnings from Amazon and Apple buoyed Wall Street futures and the dollar hovered near three-month highs on uncertainty over further Federal Reserve rate cuts.

ERDOGAN PROGRAMME

President Tayyip Erdogan will attend the TRT World Forum in Istanbul. (1130 GMT)

FOREIGN MINISTER

Turkish Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan will host his Estonian counterpart Margus Tsahkna in Ankara. They will discuss growing bilateral cooperation in defense and military sectors, Turkey-EU relations, as well as regional developments, and later hold a joint press conference.

VICE PRESIDENT

Vice President Cevdet Yilmaz will meet businesspeople in the western province Manisa province, attend an academic year start event at a university, and later take part in two programmes at the TRT World Forum. (0600 GMT) (0800 GMT) (1315 GMT)

TRADE MINISTER

Trade Minister Omer Bolat will attend the opening of the Turkey-Switzerland Economic Forum in Istanbul (0730 GMT)

PARLIAMENT

Parliament Speaker Numan Kurtulmus will attend budget talks at the parliament's planning and budget commission. (0700 GMT)

OPPOSITION

Ozgur Ozel, head of the main opposition Republican People's Party (CHP) will hold visits to some sites in Istanbul's Sariyer district and attend events in the area.

TRADE DATA

Turkish statistics institute will announce trade balance data for September (0700 GMT).

FOREIGN ARRIVALS (TRTARR=ECI)

The Tourism Ministry will announce data on foreign tourist arrivals for September. (0800 GMT)

TOURISM DATA

Culture and Tourism Minister Mehmet Nuri Ersoy will announce tourism data for the third quarter of the year at an event in Istanbul. (0700 GMT)

Turkish statistics institute will announce trade balance data for the third quarter (0700 GMT).

CENTRAL BANK MINUTES

The Central Bank will release the minutes of its monetary policy committee meeting last week, where it slowed its easing cycle with a 100 basis-point cut in its policy interest rate to 39.5%. (1100 GMT)

TREASURY BORROWING PROGRAMME

The Treasury will announce the November-January borrowing strategy. (1430 GMT)

AFGHANISTAN-PAKISTAN TALKS

Pakistan and Afghanistan agreed on Thursday to extend a ceasefire during talks in Istanbul after the worst border clashes between the neighbours in years, according to Turkey which mediated the talks along with Qatar.

ERDOGAN-MERZ MEETING

Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan criticised Germany over what he said was its ignorance of Israel's "genocide" and attacks in Gaza, at a joint news conference with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz on Thursday.

IMAMOGLU ARREST

Asked about the jailing of Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu, President Tayyip Erdogan said on Thursday that nobody can trample on laws regardless of their position, and added that the judiciary is managing the legal process as needed.

EUROFIGHTER TYPHOON DEAL

Turkey said on Thursday that talks were continuing with Qatar and Oman on procuring Eurofighter Typhoon fighters, after a deal it inked with Britain on Monday to buy 20 of the jets.

SYRIA-TURKEY COOPERATION

Syrian soldiers will be allowed to use Turkish military barracks for training meant to boost Syria's military capabilities, while 49 Syrian students will begin schooling at Turkish military academies from Friday onwards, Ankara said on Thursday.

data.title: Dabur India falls after tepid quarterly results; analysts flag ongoing structural underperformance
data.description:
** Dabur India falls 1.8% to 492.45 rupees after the release of its second-quarter results

** Co misses Q2 profit view as sweeping goods and services tax cuts disrupt sales

** Systematix says co's recent growth trends have been "underwhelming"

** Adds, beverages, hair care and oral see high competitive intensity leading to consumer/trade incentives

** Ambit says, all of Dabur's three core categories face some challenge of either structural growth or competition, underperforming despite better distribution and market share gains

** PhillipCapital says Dabur's focus on premiumization and digital-first brands to lift earnings may take time to play out, with legacy segments weak

** Stock rated "hold" on avg by 38 analysts; median PT at 541 rupees, as per data compiled by LSEG

** YTD, DABU stock down 2.5%

data.title: Hoya 2Q Eyeglass, Contact Lenses Revenue Y113.21B, Up 8.4% on Year
India's Cipla extends losses on trimming FY26 margin outlook
data.description:
** Cipla drops ~2% to 1,514.30 rupees; had lost 2.6% in last session

** On analyst call, India's no. 3 drugmaker lowers FY26 EBITDA margin outlook, citing declining contribution from generic Revlimid, higher R&D costs

** CLSA sees tepid H2 for co, almost negligible contribution from gRevlimid

** On Thursday, Cipla beat Q2 profit view, announced CEO rejig

** Stock rated "buy" on avg; median PT is 1,720 rupees, per data compiled by LSEG

** YTD, CIPL gains 0.9%

data.title: Thai Central Bank Might Need to Cut Policy Rate Deeper â€” Market Talk
data.description: The Bank of Thailand might need to cut its policy rate deeper than expected to contain the country's deflation risks, UOB economists write in a research note. Thailand's consumer prices have been contracting for six straight months. Deflation risks are increasing not only because of the negative prints for consumer prices, they say. The more salient threat is a financial, balance-sheet driven deflation, given factors including weakening bank credit and elevated private leverage. UOB expects BOT to deliver a 25bp rate cut each in December 2025 and 1Q 2026. (amanda.lee@wsj.com)

data.title: India stocks, rupee, bonds, swaps, call at 10:00 a.m. IST
data.description:
STOCKS:

The benchmark BSE Sensex was up 0.2% to 84592, while the broader NSE Nifty 50 rose 0.2% to 25923, with consolidation persisting near record highs after this month's sharp rally.

RUPEE:

The Indian rupee rose 0.06% versus the U.S. dollar to 88.6375, with traders pointing two-sided corporate flows and comfort from gains in Asian currencies.

GOVERNMENT BONDS:

The benchmark 10-year bond (IN063335G=CC) was quoted at 98.2 rupees, with the yield down 1 bp at 6.5877%, as market participants awaited the fresh debt auction for cues.

OVERNIGHT INDEX SWAPS:

The one-year overnight index swap rate (INR1YMIBROIS=CC) was nearly flat at 5.485%, while the five-year swap rate (INR5YMIBROIS=CC) rose 1.5 bps to 5.70%.

CALL MONEY:

India's overnight call money rate (INROND=) was at 5.70%, and the overnight TREPS rate (INTREPTOT=TCCL) was at 5.53%

data.title: India's Rubicon Research rises as Motial Oswal begins coverage with 'buy'
data.description:
** Shares of pharmaceutical formulations co Rubicon Research rise 2.3% to 623 rupees

** Motilal Oswal initiates coverage with "buy" rating, PT of 740 rupees; first brokerage to cover stock - per data compiled by LSEG

** Brokerage estimates annualised growth of 29%, 32%, and 43% in rev, EBITDA, and PAT, respectively

** Says growth driven by new generic launches, stronger focus on prescription-led business in CNS therapy, stable

R&D productivity, tighter supply chain management

** Adds, Rubicon's consistent compliance track record provides a strong backbone for growth in earnings and

return ratios

** Since its listing earlier this month, RUBI down nearly 3%
